<rule id="apm-00003" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <file filename="dynatrace{*}.jar"/>
                    <file filename="liboneagent.so"/>
                    <file filename="dtjavaagent.jar"/>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Application Performance Management (APM) tool - Dynatrace">
                    <message>
                        To migrate a Java application that uses Dynatrace to Azure, you can follow this recommendation:

                        * **Integrate Dynatrace**: To connect Dynatrace with your Java applications deployed on Azure, you can configure the integration based on the specific Azure service you want to use.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://www.dynatrace.com/support/help/setup-and-configuration/setup-on-cloud-platforms/microsoft-azure-services/azure-integrations/azure-appservice" title="Monitor Azure App Service using Dynatrace OneAgent"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/spring-apps/how-to-dynatrace-one-agent-monitor" title="Monitor Azure Spring Apps using Dynatrace OneAgent"/>
                    <link href="https://www.dynatrace.com/support/help/setup-and-configuration/setup-on-cloud-platforms/microsoft-azure-services/azure-integrations" title="Integrate Dynatrace on Azure"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Dynatrace</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
